name: Tomato___healthy
description: A healthy state of tomato plants free from diseases.
symptoms: No visible signs of infection or disease.
treatment: Regular care, proper watering, and pest control.
prevention: Maintain plant health with good soil management, proper spacing, and pest control.

name: Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot
description: A fungal disease caused by Septoria lycopersici, leading to the development of spots on tomato leaves.
symptoms: Small, circular, water-soaked spots with dark borders on leaves.
treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides, particularly those with copper or chlorothalonil.
prevention: Avoid overhead watering. Space plants to ensure good air circulation and reduce humidity. Rotate crops.

name: Corn_(maize)___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free corn plants.
symptoms: No visible symptoms of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Regular care and proper irrigation.
prevention: Maintain healthy soil, avoid water stress, and use resistant varieties.

name: Peach___healthy
description: A healthy state of peach trees.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest damage.
treatment: Standard care including watering, pruning, and pest management.
prevention: Ensure good spacing, avoid water stress, and remove fallen fruit to prevent pests.

name: Apple___Cedar_apple_rust
description: A fungal disease caused by Gymnosporangium juniper-virginianae affecting apples and cedars.
symptoms: Yellow-orange spots on apple leaves, with raised, rusty areas on the undersides. Infected fruit develops small brown lesions.
treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides during early spring and late fall.
prevention: Remove nearby junipers, practice good air circulation, and apply preventive fungicides.

name: Squash___Powdery_mildew
description: A fungal disease caused by Podosphaera xanthii, affecting squash and other cucurbits.
symptoms: White, powdery growth on the upper surfaces of leaves. Yellowing and curling of infected leaves.
treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides, particularly those containing sulfur or neem oil.
prevention: Space plants for good airflow. Water at the base of plants to avoid wetting the foliage.

name: Grape___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free grapevines.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Standard vine care, including pruning and pest control.
prevention: Maintain proper soil conditions, prune dead wood, and control pests regularly.

name: Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus
description: A viral disease caused by the Tomato mosaic virus (ToMV), affecting tomatoes and other Solanaceae plants.
symptoms: Mosaic-like yellow and green patterns on leaves. Stunted growth and deformed fruit.
treatment: Remove infected plants. There's no cure for the virus, so prevention is key.
prevention: Use virus-resistant tomato varieties. Practice good hygiene and remove infected plants.

name: Tomato___Bacterial_spot
description: A bacterial disease caused by Xanthomonas campestris, affecting tomatoes and other Solanaceae plants.
symptoms: Small, water-soaked lesions on leaves, followed by yellow halos and the eventual collapse of the tissue.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and plants. Use copper-based fungicides.
prevention: Rotate crops and avoid working with plants when wet. Use resistant tomato varieties.

name: Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_
description: A fungal disease caused by Puccinia sorghi, affecting corn plants.
symptoms: Small, reddish-brown pustules on the leaves and stems, causing yellowing of the leaves.
treatment: Remove infected plant material and apply fungicides if necessary.
prevention: Use resistant corn varieties and rotate crops.

name: Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew
description: A fungal disease caused by Podosphaera clandestina, affecting cherry trees.
symptoms: White, powdery spots on leaves, shoots, and flowers. Leaves may curl and turn yellow.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and shoots. Apply sulfur-based fungicides or neem oil.
prevention: Space trees for good air circulation and avoid wetting foliage during watering.

name: Apple___Apple_scab
description: A fungal disease caused by Venturia inaequalis, affecting apple trees and fruit.
symptoms: Olive-green to dark-brown lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit. Infected fruit may become deformed.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and fruit. Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or captan.
prevention: Prune trees to improve air circulation, practice crop rotation, and use resistant varieties.

name: Potato___Late_blight
description: A destructive disease caused by Phytophthora infestans, affecting potatoes and tomatoes.
symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems. Infected tubers develop brown rot.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants. Apply copper-based fungicides or specific late blight fungicides.
prevention: Use resistant potato varieties, practice crop rotation, and avoid overhead watering.

name: Strawberry___Leaf_scorch
description: A disease caused by the bacteria Xanthomonas fragariae, leading to leaf scorch on strawberry plants.
symptoms: Yellowing or browning of leaf edges, with necrotic tissue. Leaves may curl and drop prematurely.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply copper-based bactericides.
prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation, provide good spacing for air circulation, and remove debris.

name: Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening)
description: A bacterial disease caused by Candidatus Liberibacter species, affecting citrus trees.
symptoms: Yellowing of leaves, asymmetric fruit development, and bitter taste. Fruit may remain small and deformed.
treatment: There is no cure for HLB. Remove and destroy infected trees, and manage the vector insect (Asian citrus psyllid).
prevention: Prevent the spread by controlling insect vectors and removing infected trees.

name: Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight
description: A fungal disease caused by Exserohilum turcicum, affecting corn plants.
symptoms: Large, elongated, grayish-green lesions with dark borders on leaves. The disease can cause premature leaf death.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plant debris. Apply fungicides, particularly those containing strobilurins or triazoles.
prevention: Plant resistant corn varieties and practice crop rotation.

name: Pepper,_bell___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free bell pepper plants.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Regular care including proper watering and pest management.
prevention: Maintain healthy soil, avoid water stress, and use pest control practices.

name: Grape___Black_rot
description: A fungal disease caused by Guignardia bidwellii, affecting grapevines.
symptoms: Dark brown to black lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit. Infected fruit shrivels and turns black.
treatment: Remove infected plant parts and apply fungicides containing myclobutanil or sulfur.
prevention: Prune grapevines to improve airflow and space plants. Practice good vineyard sanitation.

name: Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot
description: A bacterial disease caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria, affecting bell peppers.
symptoms: Small, water-soaked lesions with yellow halos on leaves, stems, and fruit. The lesions enlarge and cause tissue collapse.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and fruits. Apply copper-based bactericides or streptomycin.
prevention: Use resistant pepper varieties, avoid working with wet plants, and practice crop rotation.

name: Tomato___Early_blight
description: A fungal disease caused by Alternaria solani, affecting tomatoes.
symptoms: Concentric, dark brown lesions on lower leaves, often surrounded by yellow halos. Lesions may appear on stems and fruit.
treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides such as chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
prevention: Rotate crops, avoid overhead watering, and remove fallen plant debris.

name: Blueberry___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free blueberry plants.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Regular care including proper watering, pruning, and pest management.
prevention: Maintain healthy soil, avoid water stress, and apply balanced fertilizers.

name: Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free cherry trees.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Regular care including proper watering, pruning, and pest management.
prevention: Maintain proper spacing for good air circulation and apply preventative treatments for pests.

name: Potato___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free potato plants.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Maintain regular care with proper irrigation, soil fertility, and pest management.
prevention: Rotate crops, use healthy seed potatoes, and avoid water stress.

name: Apple___Black_rot
description: A fungal disease caused by Botryosphaeria obtusa, affecting apple trees and fruit.
symptoms: Circular lesions with purple edges and brown centers on leaves. Black, sunken lesions on fruit with concentric rings.
treatment: Remove infected fruit and cankers. Apply fungicides like mancozeb or captan.
prevention: Prune and destroy dead wood, maintain tree health with proper fertilization, and apply fungicides during the growing season.

name: Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot)
description: A fungal disease caused by Isariopsis viticola, affecting grapevines.
symptoms: Small, circular lesions with dark edges on leaves. Lesions enlarge and cause yellowing of the surrounding tissue.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides containing copper or sulfur.
prevention: Prune to improve airflow, avoid overhead irrigation, and apply preventative fungicides.

name: Tomato___Target_Spot
description: A fungal disease caused by Corynespora cassiicola, affecting tomatoes.
symptoms: Round, dark spots with concentric rings on leaves, stems, and fruit. Infected fruit may develop sunken lesions.
treatment: Remove infected plant parts and apply fungicides such as chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
prevention: Practice crop rotation, avoid overhead irrigation, and remove fallen plant debris.

name: Tomato___Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider_mite
description: A pest infestation caused by Tetranychus urticae, affecting tomato plants.
symptoms: Fine webbing on leaves, yellowing, stippling, and curling of leaves. Heavy infestations can cause defoliation.
treatment: Spray with miticides or insecticidal soaps, and remove heavily infested leaves.
prevention: Use resistant varieties, avoid water stress, and regularly inspect for pests.

name: Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus
description: A viral disease caused by Tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV), affecting tomato plants.
symptoms: Yellowing of leaves, curling, stunted growth, and reduced fruit production.
treatment: There is no cure for TYLCV. Remove and destroy infected plants, control vector insects.
prevention: Use resistant varieties and control the whitefly vector that transmits the virus.

name: Apple___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free apple trees.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Regular care including proper irrigation, pruning, and pest management.
prevention: Maintain good orchard sanitation, and apply appropriate fertilizers.

name: Soybean___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free soybean plants.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Maintain proper care with appropriate watering and pest management.
prevention: Practice crop rotation, use resistant varieties, and maintain healthy soil.

name: Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles)
description: A fungal disease caused by several species of fungi, affecting grapevines, particularly old vines.
symptoms: Wood decay, necrosis of xylem tissues, leaf chlorosis, and poor fruit development. Black streaks may appear on older wood.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected wood. Use fungicides like copper-based or systemic fungicides.
prevention: Use resistant grape varieties, and ensure proper vine care, pruning, and spacing for good air circulation.

name: Raspberry___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free raspberry plants.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Regular care including proper watering, pruning, and pest management.
prevention: Maintain healthy soil, avoid water stress, and apply balanced fertilizers.

name: Strawberry___healthy
description: Healthy, disease-free strawberry plants.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or pest infestation.
treatment: Regular care including proper watering, pruning, and pest management.
prevention: Maintain proper spacing for good air circulation and apply preventative treatments for pests.

name: Peach___Bacterial_spot
description: A bacterial disease caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. pruni, affecting peach trees.
symptoms: Watery lesions on leaves, fruit, and twigs. Yellow halos surround lesions on leaves. Fruit may develop spots and become deformed.
treatment: Remove infected parts and apply copper-based bactericides.
prevention: Prune trees to improve air circulation, avoid overhead irrigation, and use resistant varieties.

name: Potato___Early_blight
description: A fungal disease caused by Alternaria solani, affecting potato plants.
symptoms: Dark, concentric spots on older leaves, which may develop a yellow halo. Infected fruit may develop sunken lesions.
treatment: Remove infected plant parts and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
prevention: Practice crop rotation, avoid overhead irrigation, and remove fallen plant debris.

name: Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_leaf_spot
description: A fungal disease caused by Cercospora species and other fungi, affecting corn plants.
symptoms: Grayish-brown lesions with dark borders on leaves. Infected leaves turn yellow and may die prematurely.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides containing strobilurins or triazoles.
prevention: Use resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, and avoid water stress.

name: Tomato___Leaf_Mold
description: A fungal disease caused by Passalora fulva, affecting tomato plants.
symptoms: Yellow, water-soaked spots on the upper surface of leaves, with fuzzy, grayish-green mold on the underside.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides such as chlorothalonil or copper-based fungicides.
prevention: Increase airflow around plants, avoid overhead watering, and apply preventative fungicides.

name: Tomato___Late_blight
description: A serious disease caused by the fungus-like organism Phytophthora infestans, affecting tomatoes and potatoes.
symptoms: Dark, water-soaked spots on leaves that quickly enlarge to form purple-brown, oily-looking blotches. White fungal growth may appear on the undersides of leaves. Infected fruits develop dark, firm lesions.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plant parts. Apply copper-based fungicides or specific late blight fungicides. In severe cases, remove entire plants to prevent spread.
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Provide good air circulation by proper spacing. Water at the base of plants. Apply preventative fungicides during humid weather. Practice crop rotation.
